digital-experience-healthcare/contact.ht.overview: Contact page for Digital Experience Healthcare allowing users to submit inquiries via a form, view contact details, and access FAQs. Includes success/error banners, accessibility features, and theme toggle.
key_components: Navbar with navigation links and theme toggle
Success and error banners for form submission feedback
Contact information panel with phone, email, address, emergency details
Contact form with validation and character count
interactions: Skip to content link navigation
Theme toggle button switches light/dark mode
Form field input validation and error display
Submit button enables when required fields are valid
Success banner appears on successful submission
Error banner appears on failed submission
Banner close buttons dismiss alerts
data_flow: User enters form data → client-side validation updates validation messages
Valid form enables submit button → submission triggers success or error banner
Character count updates dynamically in message field
Dismiss buttons hide banners
Theme toggle updates UI state (likely stored in localStorage or CSS class)
accessibility: Skip link for keyboard navigation
ARIA roles and labels on navigation, form, and banners
aria-live regions for dynamic validation and alert messages
aria-required and aria-describedby for form fields
Keyboard focusable elements: links, buttons, inputs
test_ideas: Verify skip link moves focus to main content
Validate theme toggle changes visual mode and persists state
Ensure form validation messages appear for missing/invalid inputs
Confirm submit button enables only when required fields are valid
Simulate successful submission and verify success banner visibility and dismissal
Simulate failed submission and verify error banner visibility and dismissal
Check character count updates as user types in message field
Validate accessibility attributes (aria-live, aria-required, aria-label)
Verify navigation links route correctly
Ensure analytics events fire on key interactions

digital-experience-healthcare/index.html.overview: A semantic, accessible, and responsive healthcare homepage featuring navigation, hero content, informational sections, CTAs, and a footer. It includes accessibility hooks, test IDs, and a theme toggle for user interaction.
key_components: Navbar with brand and navigation links
Hero section with heading, description, and SVG illustration
Introduction section with three feature cards
CTA section with service and contact links
Footer with quick links and contact info
interactions: Clicking navigation links routes to other pages
Theme toggle button switches dark/light mode
Skip-to-content link focuses main content
Back-to-top button scrolls to top when visible
CTA buttons navigate to services or contact pages
data_flow: Static HTML content rendered from index.html
Theme toggle state likely persisted via main.js
CTA and nav links trigger client-side or full-page navigation
Toast container receives dynamic messages from main.js
accessibility: Skip-to-content link for keyboard users
ARIA roles and labels on navigation, hero image, and footer
Proper heading hierarchy (h1-h3)
Keyboard-accessible buttons and links
aria-live region for toast notifications
analytics: Potential click tracking on CTA and nav links
Scroll or visibility tracking for back-to-top button
test_ideas: Verify skip-to-content focuses #main-content
Validate theme-toggle toggles aria-pressed and updates theme
Ensure nav links navigate correctly and highlight active page
Check CTA buttons route to correct pages
Confirm back-to-top button appears after scroll and functions
Validate all sections render with correct headings and content
Test toast container announces messages via aria-live
Run accessibility audit for WCAG compliance

digital-experience-healthcare/main.js.overview: This JavaScript file initializes interactive behaviors for a healthcare website, including theme toggling, back-to-top visibility, skip-to-content accessibility, CTA tracking, search/filter/sort for service cards, FAQ accordion persistence, and tabbed content management. It also logs user interactions to a global analytics array.
interactions: Click theme toggle to switch between light/dark modes
Scroll to trigger back-to-top visibility
Click back-to-top to scroll smoothly to top
Click skip-to-content to focus main content
Click CTA links to log analytics events
Type in search input to filter cards
Click filter chips to toggle active state and filter cards
Change sort dropdown to reorder visible cards
Click FAQ buttons to expand/collapse panels and persist state
Click tab buttons to switch visible panels
data_flow: User actions trigger DOM updates and analytics logging via logEvent()
Theme preference stored in localStorage under 'theme'
FAQ open state stored in localStorage under 'faq-open-index'
Search/filter/sort functions manipulate card visibility and order
Analytics events appended to window.analyticsLog
accessibility: ARIA attributes for theme toggle, back-to-top, filter chips, FAQ, and tabs
Skip-to-content link focuses main region with temporary tabindex
Back-to-top button toggles aria-hidden based on scroll position
Filter chips maintain aria-pressed state
FAQ buttons manage aria-expanded and aria-controls
Tabs manage aria-selected, aria-hidden, and keyboard focus
test_ideas: Verify theme toggle updates DOM attribute, localStorage, and logs event
Assert back-to-top visibility toggles after scrolling threshold
Ensure skip-to-content focuses main element and restores tabindex
Validate CTA clicks log correct analytics payloads
Confirm search filters cards by title/description text
Check filter chips toggle active class and aria-pressed state
Ensure sort dropdown reorders visible cards correctly
Verify FAQ accordion expands one item at a time and persists state
Confirm tabs switch panels and update ARIA attributes
Validate analyticsLog entries contain correct event types and timestamps

digital-experience-healthcare/more-infor.overview: The 'More Information' page of Digital Experience Healthcare provides a searchable and filterable list of healthcare services. It includes navigation, theme toggle, search input, filter chips, sorting dropdown, and dynamically loaded service cards with skeleton loaders.
key_components: Sticky navigation bar with theme toggle
Search bar with input and icon
Service cards grid with skeleton loaders
interactions: Clicking theme toggle switches between light and dark modes
Typing in search input filters visible service cards
Clicking filter chips filters cards by category
Changing sort dropdown reorders service cards
Navigation links route between pages
Skeleton loaders replaced by service cards after data load
data_flow: Initial load shows skeleton loaders
Frontend script fetches or reveals service data
Search and filter inputs update visible service cards
Sort dropdown changes order based on selected criteria
Theme toggle updates global UI state
accessibility: Skip link for keyboard navigation
ARIA labels on navigation and filter groups
Visually hidden labels for search input
Alt text on all service images
aria-current on active navigation link
Keyboard focusable buttons and inputs
analytics: Track search input usage and query terms
Track filter chip clicks and selected categories
test_ideas: Verify skip link focuses main content
Ensure navbar links navigate correctly
Validate theme toggle persists state across reloads
Test search input filters cards by title and description
Test each filter chip shows only matching service cards
Test sort dropdown orders cards alphabetically and by popularity
Confirm skeleton loaders disappear after data load
Check all images have alt text and load lazily
Validate ARIA roles and labels for accessibility compliance
Verify analytics events fire on user interactions

digital-experience-healthcare/styles.css.overview: The stylesheet defines a design system and layout utilities for a healthcare digital experience frontend. It establishes design tokens, responsive grid layouts, typography, accessibility helpers, and base element resets to ensure consistent UI behavior across breakpoints and themes.
key_components: Design tokens (:root variables for color, typography, spacing, shadows, transitions)
Hero, section, and content layout classes
interactions: Hover and focus-visible states for links and buttons
Skip-to-content focus transition for keyboard navigation
Responsive grid adjustments at breakpoints (640px, 768px, 1024px)
Dark mode variable overrides
data_flow: CSS variables cascade from :root to components
Media queries override layout and spacing at breakpoints
Dark mode overrides color tokens based on user preference
accessibility: Focus-visible outlines for keyboard users
.visually-hidden for screen-reader-only content
.skip-to-content link for bypassing navigation
High-contrast color tokens for dark mode
analytics: No explicit analytics hooks in CSS; test for presence of data-attributes or JS event bindings in markup
Potential tracking on interactive elements (links, buttons) via external scripts
test_ideas: Verify responsive grid layouts adjust correctly at defined breakpoints
Validate dark mode color tokens apply when prefers-color-scheme: dark is active
Check focus-visible outlines appear on keyboard navigation
Ensure skip-to-content link becomes visible and functional on focus
Confirm consistent typography and spacing across sections
Test hover and disabled states for buttons and links
Validate container max-widths and padding across viewport sizes
